title: Are there publishers in India or available online who publish books for free? - Quora

response.answer_text: You could consider self-publishing. All major self-publishing platforms also support authors from India. Here are some that you can try. Self-publish your book to Amazon's Kindle Store - free to self-publishEbooks from independent authors and publishers - free to self-publishDraft2Digital | Welcome - free to self-publishGoogle Books - free to self-publishFor print books, a print on demand service like CreateSpace (free to self-publish) is probably the best bet, but delivery to India might be expensive compared to the US, Canada and Europe. If you are looking for an Indian company to help with publishing, Self Publishing and Print on Demand in India (free service if you can provide fully formatted content) or Book Publishers in India (paid service) could be considered. Royalties on KDP, the largest marketplace for eBooks vary from 35% to 70% depending on the pricing of the book, the country in which the purchase is made and also based on whether you enroll in KDP Select (where you have to keep your books exclusive to Amazon). Details are available at the link  provided above. Royalties on other platforms vary from 30% to 60%. There are no legal issues that I am aware of, other than the fact that income from royalties will be taxable in India. Also look at the pros and cons of self-publishing vs. traditional publishing below. Self Publishing Pros Better control of the publishing process - complete creative freedom to choose what you want to include and howBetter royalties - no cut for the publisher. You decide your pricing and royalties. eBook royalties can be as high as 70%.Faster to market - you can self-publish an eBook that you have ready in a matter of minutes and make it available worldwideNo restrictions for newbie authorsCons Discoverability - your book is the proverbial needle in the haystackMarketing - you are responsible for all marketing effortsIf you are opting for a print edition, there might be an upfront cost involved - except in the case of Print-on-demand optionTraditional Publishing Pros You have the backing of a reputed publishing house - better discoverabilityMarketing is part of the book publishing deal and the publisher helps to an extentProfessional editing, formatting and cover designMade available through all major bookstores and online retailersCons Can take a significant amount of time (months) to get a book to the marketNew authors might find it difficult to get the backing of a good publisher - others might charge a one time publishing fee starting from INR 25,000.Lower royalties - 10 - 15% of selling price for print editionsDo feel free to let me know if you have any specific questions.
